oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: letter to Gold Star mother from "La Bienvenue Francaise"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This is a single page letter with printed letterhead and mimeographed body and hand written signatures at the bottom of the page. The text expresses affection of the French women for the sacrifice of Gold Star Mothers in the defense of French soil. The letter is dated "Paris Summer 1933." It was part of the collection of Sarah Frances M. Ring. She had three sons that served in WW I. Her youngest son, Frank, was killed in action in October 1918 as a member of the 114th MG Battn. 30th Div.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
